title: Social Media-Based Self-Regulated Science Teaching Expertise Development Course (Large-Scale)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic knowledge of elementary science education and fundamental social media proficiency
context.additional_context: A process applying self-regulated learning strategies to help elementary science teachers use social media for continuous professional development

learning_goals: Learners can apply strategies to filter and systematically collect useful information from social media platforms (Facebook groups, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, blogs, etc.) related to science education.
Learners can establish and execute social media-based professional development plans using the self-regulated learning (SRL) model (planning-execution-reflection).
Learners can exchange feedback in online learning communities and generate at least three ideas applicable to science education settings.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
